variant.question: When flying in accordance with IFR, which of the following best describes the term "visual approach"?

options.text: An approach by an IFR flight when either part or all of an instrument approach procedure is not completed and the approach is executed in visual reference to terrain.
A visual manoeuvre executed by an IFR flight when the weather conditions at the aerodrome of destination are equal to or better than the required VMC minima.
An extension of an instrument approach procedure to bring an aircraft into position for landing on a runway which is not suitably located for straight-in-approach.
An approach executed by an IFR flight unable to maintain VMC.
